changelog.entry: Added Lifeform Scanner and Slug blue options in MANTIS_CREW event

event.name: MANTIS_CREW
event.text: You detect and retrieve an escape pod floating nearby. You consider returning it to space when you learn it's Mantis.
You send the pod back out the airlock. You're not stupid.
The Mantis inside is FURIOUS. He cuts the closest person in half with a single swipe. Kill it before anyone else is hurt.

removeCrew.text: The Mantis is shocked to see the crewmember it just slaughtered step out of the Clone Bay.

event.text: The Mantis inside considers you a messenger from the god of mercy and demands to join your crew.
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

choice.text: (Orchid) Fill the room with calming aroma before opening the escape pod.

event.text: The Mantis inside is resting. After waking up, they are happy to breathe fresh air, and move their limbs freely. The Mantis offers to join your crew until they can find the way home.
A man steps out of the pod. He looks stressed after spending so much time in a tiny pod but seeing that you're friendly, composes himself and offers to join your crew for a time.

choice.text: (Pavonian) Stun whoever is hidden inside the pod after opening.

event.text: The Mantis inside is FURIOUS. But it's completely blinded by radiant colors of your Pavonian crewmember after spending so long in tiny escape pod. Kill it before anyone is hurt.
The Mantis inside is shocked by radiant colors colors of your Pavonian crewmember and considers you a messenger from the god of mercy. It demands to join your crew.

A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming, blinded by radiant colors colors of your Pavonian crewmember, and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Check the pod for life.

event.text: You're surprised to detect a human inside. You pry open the pod and they burst out in a panic, screaming - a rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew.
You detect a live Mantis inside. Mantis are not known for their gratefulness; you consider how to proceed.
You send the pod back out the airlock - it's not worth the risk.
